events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 1st involving her vehicle and another car at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and confirming the involvement of a motor vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and coordinate the following procedures.
Acknowledgment of the received claim was sent to the customer, confirming that the process has officially started.
The agent requested additional documents from the customer including accident photos, police report, and vehicle registration.
The customer promptly submitted all requested documents electronically, including detailed photos of the vehicle damage.
The insurance company's investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted the police department for the report.
Investigation concluded with findings that the customerâ€™s vehicle was hit by a negligent driver who has been identified.
A settlement amount covering all repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed and sent to the customer for approval.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and thanked the insurance company for quick handling.
Following customer approval, the claim was officially approved by the insurance adjuster for final processing.
The agreed settlement payment was issued to the customer's bank account to cover all repair expenses promptly.
The insurance claim was formally closed after confirming the customer had received payment and was satisfied with the resolution.
The case file was archived in the company system for future reference and compliance with record-keeping policies.
